result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Richard Van Aernum

defendant.name: Van Aernum, Scott Richard
defendant.address: 11514 S Railroad St, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM Defendant Scott Richard VanAernum in court.  Attorney Nate Cockerham in court for Scott Richard VanAernum.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Defendant Scott Richard VanAernum in court.  Attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky not in court.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court quashes warrant; questions failure to appear.
Defendant received a text message from his attorney at about 630am  that he was going to reschedule and he did not need to appear. 
Court explains option to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Attorney is ill that may be good cause.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing so he is able to have his counsel with.
State requests signature bond be reinstated and reschedule.
Court continues signature bond and reschedules.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:11 AM Defendant Scott Richard VanAernum not in court.  Attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky not in court.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court understands that his attorney is ill and had wanted to reschedule.  Told his client he did not need to appear.
State indicates that Attorney Wyshnytzky contacted her to let her know he was ill. State notified their witness so they did not appear.  Has no objection to re setting the matter after 930 on 11/2/22
Court does not forfeit bail; orders a warrant to issue.  Will schedule when defendant appears in court.
Apple iPhone in a black otterbox case that belongs to Scott R Vanaernum (DOB: 6/5/1985) Data and information from March 1, 2022 to September 15, 2022
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

1:49 PM Defendant Scott Richard VanAernum in court.  Attorney Lucas Wyshnytzky appears with defendant. Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified.  Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, asks for preliminary hearing, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea.
State indicates has $2500 signature bond already with no contact with TEV except through Our Family Wizard. 
Attorney Wyshnytzky indicates injunction language is different and would need to be changed. Indicates they are working on changing this language. 
Court orders 2500 signature bond and no contact with TEV except through parents.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
